solution.text:
In the given data, there are a total of _{{j+k+l+n+o+l+o+l+n+l+j+l+k+l+l+j+k+n+o}}_ students surveyed.
Of that number, _{{j+k}}_ students have a birthday in November

We know that
\(P(E) = \frac{Number\;of\;trials\;in\;which\;E\;has\;happened}{Total\;number\;of\;trials}\)

Therefore the Probability of the Event, P(E), of Rajiv having a birthday in November is : \(\frac{_{{j+k}}_}{_{{j+k+l+n+o+l+o+l+n+l+j+l+k+l+l+j+k+n+o}}_}\) = \(_{{Fraction((j+k),(j+k+l+n+o+l+o+l+n+l+j+l+k+l+l+j+k+n+o))}}_\)

content.text:
Your friend Rajiv hands you the table below which is a report of data from all the students in his class. Based on the data, what is the probability that he was born in November? (Enter the answer as a simplified fraction)
Birth MonthNumber of Students
January_{j}_
February_{k}_
March_{l}_
April_{n}_
May_{o}_
June_{{l+o}}_
July_{{l+n}}_
August_{{l+j}}_
September_{{l+k}}_
October_{{l+l}}_
November_{{j+k}}_
December_{{n+o}}_
